test_cases.evidence_output:
<evidence>
  <item>
    <source_id>PLAN_A_RULE_001</source_id>
    <snippet>A claim is considered a duplicate if the same patient, provider, date of service, and CPT/HCPCS code appear in a previously paid claim within the same benefit year. Duplicate services require new clinical documentation to justify medical necessity.</snippet>
    <relevance_score>0.95</relevance_score>
    <claim_id>C10045</claim_id>
  </item>
  <item>
    <source_id>PLAN_A_CLAIM_THRESHOLD</source_id>
    <snippet>Total billed amount per claim must not exceed **$1,500.00**. Claims exceeding this threshold require itemized line-level breakdown and financial review.</snippet>
    <relevance_score>0.95</relevance_score>
    <claim_id>C10045</claim_id>
  </item>
  <item>
    <source_id>PLAN_A_RULE_003</source_id>
    <snippet>All procedure lines must include at least one valid ICD-10-CM diagnosis code that aligns with CMS medical necessity guidelines. Claims missing diagnosis codes will be returned for correction.</snippet>
    <relevance_score>0.95</relevance_score>
    <claim_id>C10045</claim_id>
  </item>
  <item>
    <source_id>PLAN_A_NON_COVERED_CODES</source_id>
    <snippet>The following services are explicitly excluded from coverage under Plan A: - `80050`, `80048` – General health panels and comprehensive metabolic panels - `G0101` – Cervical cancer screening (covered only under preventive benefit with specific modifiers) - `X9999`, `S9999` – Non-standard or experimental codes > *Source: Plan A Benefits Handbook, Section 5.1 & 7.3*</snippet>
    <relevance_score>0.95</relevance_score>
    <claim_id>C10045</claim_id>
  </item>
</evidence>
test_cases.audit_output:
<final_audit>
  <claim_id>C10045</claim_id>
  <summary>Four violations were identified: duplicate billing, amount exceeding plan threshold, missing diagnosis, and non-covered service. The total recommended recovery is $370.00 for medium and high severity issues.</summary>
  <total_recommended_recovery>370.00</total_recommended_recovery>
  <confidence_score>0.95</confidence_score>
  <violations_count>4</violations_count>
  <violations_reference>V-0001,V-0002,V-0003,V-0004</violations_reference>
  <next_steps>create_appeal,request_documentation</next_steps>
  <appeal_recommended>true</appeal_recommended>
  <appeal_reason>Significant recovery is recommended due to duplicate billing, threshold excess, and non-covered service.</appeal_reason>
  <audit_trail>
    <entry agent="RuleCheckerAgent" ts="2025-11-06T07:48:01Z">Detected 4 violations</entry>
    <entry agent="EvidenceAgent" ts="2025-11-06T07:48:01Z">Retrieved 4 evidence snippets</entry>
    <entry agent="AuditSynthAgent" ts="2025-11-06T07:48:01Z">Synthesized final audit packet</entry>
  </audit_trail>
</final_audit>
test_cases.appeal_output: Your denial and appeal notification has been sent to the provider, including a clear explanation of the audit findings, policy references, total recovery amount, and instructions for appeal.
